hero.title: Health, ageing and quality of life
hero.subtitle: Rats live fast and age quickly. Responsible keeping includes planning for illness and the end of life from the very beginning.

body.text: Respiratory infections, mammary tumors, abscesses and age-related weakness are among the most common health issues in pet rats.

items: Early vet visits can prevent mild problems from becoming emergencies.
Weight tracking helps catch subtle changes before they are visible.
Some conditions are more related to genetics, others to environment.

body.text: Because rats age quickly, it is important to think about what a good life and a good end look like before a crisis happens.
At Ratopia we encourage adopters to observe not only whether a rat is alive, but whether they can still do rat things: move, groom, interact, eat with minimal struggle and rest comfortably.
